pr_title: grpc code generation - option to scan dependencies for imports

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason for not having quarkus.generate-code.grpc.scan-for-imports as true by default ? Would it hurt the performance ?
timeline.author: gaetancollaud
timeline.diffHunk:

 With this configuration, you can put your service and message definitions in the `src/main/proto` directory.
 `quarkus-maven-plugin` will generate Java files from your `proto` files.
+
+Please note that by default only the proto files in the `src/main/proto` and `src/test/proto` will be compiled and available as protobuf imports.

replies.bodyText: that's what I'm afraid. But let's see what others think
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz

replies.bodyText: Adding the proto files as imports doesn't seem to cost much, I'm afraid that scanning all the dependencies can cost a bit
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, not sure jandex has anything for resources.
We may try to recognize well-known dependencies.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText:
I was actually thinking of giving users three options:

none for the current behavior
all for scanning all dependencies
a comma separated list of groupId:artifactId to scan

With default of com.google.protobuf:protobuf-java, WDYT?
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz

replies.bodyText: the heavy lifting is done because I can pass the propetry through, I'll update the PR with ^
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's what I meant. If com.google.protobuf:protobuf-java is there, or any well-known dependency containing protobuf files we should pick them (exception if configured otherwise such as a comma-separated list).
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText: Looks like we could re-use realProperties instead of re-building them again?
